image.altText: Women in cricket gear train at Manuka oval

props.synopsis: After being evacuated from Afghanistan to Australia in 2021, these women have just played their first cricket match as a team — ever.

title.children: 'No, we are not okay': How these women who fled Afghanistan in terror came to play cricket in Australia

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The girl's then-employer has pleaded guilty to charges relating to sexual relationships she engaged in with her and two other separate victims.

title.children: Teenage girl groomed by employer tells court her 'innocence' was taken

image.altText: Gel-blaster seized by ACT police

props.synopsis: A Canberra man is charged with manslaughter nearly five years after the death of another man following an alleged brawl in Banks.

title.children: Canberra man arrested years after man died following alleged brawl

image.altText: A young girl with chin length brown hair smiles.

props.synopsis: The wait for two-year-old Lily to have her tonsils and adenoids removed in Canberra's public health system was up to 10 years, and a proposal to reduce agency staff is unlikely to see wait times improve.

title.children: Lily faced a 10 year wait for surgery. It's unclear if more funding will help

image.altText: A woman with glasses looks close to the camera.

props.synopsis: Between July and December of 2024, Canberra Health Services saw a jump in patient visits of 85,000 compared to the first six months of the 2023 financial year, and Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith has today announced plans to inject $227.3 million to meet demand.

title.children: Canberra hospitals record 85,000 more patient visits in six months

image.altText: A crowd of young Groovin The Moo festival-goers raise their hands and cheer.

props.synopsis: It follows Splendour in the Grass's announcement last week that it will also not be returning for 2025.

title.children: Groovin the Moo won't return in 2025, following last year's cancellation

image.altText: A photo of the club from out front, a large building with pillars, multistorey and with pillars.

props.synopsis: The Hellenic Club of Canberra is reprimanded and ordered to pay the ACT government $1.2 million after the death by suicide of a man who was in debt due to problem gambling using its poker machines.

title.children: Hellenic Club fined $1.2m over problem gambling of man who later died by suicide

image.altText: A young Mick Jagger and Marianne Faithfull walking with their arms interlocked in front of brick buildings

props.synopsis: Between 1964 and 1970 Faithfull was a pop star, part of British rock royalty. The lows began with her use of narcotics and ended with time spent as a homeless junkie.

title.children: Marianne Faithfull remembered as a woman 'full of surprises and contradictions'

image.altText: Australian Opposition Leader Peter Dutton talks during an address to the Menzies Research Centre.

props.synopsis: After President Donald Trump's successful campaign targeting "diversity, equity and inclusion" initiatives in US workplaces, Opposition Leader Peter Dutton vows to scale back similar positions in the public service.

title.children: Mirroring Trump, Peter Dutton takes aim at diversity and inclusion workforce

image.altText: a man does a peace sign in front of a small crowd of protesters

props.synopsis: The Australian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) will consider a complaint made against Opposition Leader Peter Dutton, which accuses him of discrimination and inciting racial hatred through public statements following the Hamas terrorist attack on October 7, 2023.

title.children: Human rights body to consider complaint against Peter Dutton over Israel-Gaza commentary

image.altText: Mitchell Starc walks off the field as groundstaff cover the pitch during a Test against Sri Lanka in Galle.

props.synopsis: Rain in Galle forces an early lunch and stays around until stumps after Australia picked up two Sri Lankan wickets in the morning session on day three of the first Test.

title.children: Play ends early as rain settles in on day three of first Test in Galle

image.altText: Annabel Sutherland holds up her bat and helmet

props.synopsis: Having dominated the opening day, Australia returns for a second helping at the MCG looking to pile the punishment onto England's bowlers in the Women's Ashes Test. Follow live.

title.children: Sutherland's brilliant 150 sets Australia up as England's wheels fall off

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: BOWLED HER! SUTHERLAND HAS TO GO!
THAT'S DINNER! Australia 3-278 (Sutherland 135*, Mooney 43*) leads England by 108 runs

image.altText: Men living in a boarding house in Sydney pose in their homes.

props.synopsis: The 28 vulnerable boarders due to be evicted from a Sydney boarding house this weekend have been given a one month reprieve, but more than half of them still have nowhere to go as the clock ticks down.

title.children: Pensioners prepare to leave 'forever home' as eviction deadline knocks

image.altText: A smiling young girl in a park.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest is set to examine whether there were system failures that led to the death of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs.

title.children: Queensland coroner to examine death of Elizabeth Struhs

image.altText: A man taking a photo of himself through the reflection of a car side mirror

props.synopsis: A Perth man who drugged multiple women before filming himself sexually assaulting them is jailed for 28 years.

title.children: 'You stole something': Perth sex predator jailed for dozens of crimes

image.altText: A graffiti bird on a silo

props.synopsis: For more than a year, "Pam the Bird" soared over Melbourne, appearing on city landmarks, skyscrapers and road signs. But the cartoon bird's alleged creator could be grounded.

title.children: 'Notorious vandal': Police say accused was unemployed, sometimes violent

image.altText: Hospital exterior.

props.synopsis: Newcastle's John Hunter Hospital has apologised for the "hurt" caused by an email sent by its Human Resources Department that ridiculed junior doctors.

title.children: Email mistakenly sent by hospital compares junior doctors to marshmallows

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Ariel Bombara speaking at a press conference

props.synopsis: An internal investigation into the actions of WA Police officers in the weeks before Mark Bombara killed two women in the Perth suburb of Floreat finds eight officers did not perform their duty.

title.children: Probe finds eight police officers at fault before Floreat murders

image.altText: Maree and Mervyn Schwartz smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: A north Queensland grazier accused of killing three of his neighbours has been refused bail, with the alleged offences described in court as "execution-style killings".

title.children: Grazier accused of triple murder refused bail over 'execution-style killings'

image.altText: A smiling woman holds her hand to her cheek

props.synopsis: Authorities in Victoria and New South Wales have issued public warnings about an unregistered cosmetic practitioner who injected patients with dodgy botox.

title.children: Suspected Victorian botulism case revealed, NSW starts investigation

image.altText: George Pell

props.synopsis: Two men were compensated after the National Redress Scheme accepted they were abused as boys by the late Cardinal George Pell in Ballarat in the 1970s.

title.children: George Pell raped, groped two boys in Ballarat, compensation scheme decides

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks with a US flag behind him.

props.synopsis: Less than 15 hours after the Washington DC air crash that killed 67 people, Donald Trump places blame on past Democratic leaders and initiatives to boost diversity in aviation, without specific evidence.

title.children: Trump says air crash cause unknown, but he blames Democrats and diversity

image.altText: Six dogs in the back of a buggy, a border collie in the middle is surrounded by kelpies.

props.synopsis: Collies and kelpies are beloved working dogs and pets, but each has very different personality and behavioural traits. This is what to keep in mind about whether one would suit you and your family.

title.children: Experts weigh in on why collies make better pets than kelpies

image.altText: close of donald trump inside air force one airplane

props.synopsis: Have you been paying attention to the news this week? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Check your PIN, Trump's immigration scuffle and another music festival bows out

image.altText: Woman laying in hospital bed in coma.

props.synopsis: The father of Linley Anyos, who was allegedly shot while sitting in the passenger seat of a car outside a Tallebudgera property, says her injuries will change her life forever.

title.children: Gold Coast woman still in a 'horrific way' weeks after car shooting

image.altText: A selfie of a man and a woman on a street. The woman is wearing black, the man is wearing a grey hoodie and has a cigarette.

props.synopsis: The pair are allegedly connected to the caravan filled with explosives believed to have a potential blast zone of 40 metres, and considered to be on the periphery of a broader antisemitism terror investigation.

title.children: What we know about the couple allegedly linked to the Dural caravan

image.altText: Richard Barron pictured in an office, smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The principal of Langwarrin Park Primary School, Richard Barren, is charged with possessing child abuse material, the Victorian Education Department has confirmed.

title.children: Melbourne principal charged with child abuse material possession

image.altText: Woman wearing green shirt and holding microphone.

props.synopsis: Proponents of nuclear energy have launched a campaign to win the hearts and minds of towns promised nuclear facilities if the Coalition wins the next election.

title.children: Former Miss America goes to Coal mining town to 'break misconceptions' about nuclear

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas and men from Santos stand on scaffolding at the Moomba CCS

props.synopsis: Santos says it's captured and stored 340,000 tonnes of CO2 and is on track to significantly expand operations — but an energy expert says in the scheme of Australia's 500 million tonnes of yearly emissions, it's more "PR exercise" than climate change solution.

title.children: As Santos celebrates carbon capture, expert says it's 'hardly a drop'

image.altText: A man in a suit and with frizzy grey hair smiles holding a mic on-stage against a green LED background.

props.synopsis: The Flaming Lips are currently on tour in Australia, and frontman Wayne Coyne dropped in for a chat with Double J's Zan Rowe about how music makes him fearless.

title.children: Most bands hate their hits, but The Flaming Lips aren't most bands

image.altText: Man standing in gardens

props.synopsis: A District Court Judge has asked for more evidence as to how much a by-election would cost before deciding whether to postpone Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell's sentencing on theft and dishonest dealing with documents offences.

title.children: By-election cost raised in Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell’s fraud case

image.altText: A woman celebrates a wicket in a cricket match

props.synopsis: A sharp spell from spinner Ashleigh van Wyck has sent Australia packing from the under-19s T20 World Cup semifinal with South Africa cruising to a five-wicket victory.

title.children: South Africa skittle Aussies in semifinal of under-19s T20 World Cup

image.altText: Tavishi Pandya carries a surf board at Bondi Beach.

props.synopsis: The number of Britons in Australia on working holiday visas is at an all-time high after the eligibility was broadened, but experts warn the relaxing of rules is "discriminatory".

title.children: UK backpackers exempt from regional work 'will have consequences', expert warns

image.altText: Timber beams in the background with a silver duct hanging off a wall.

props.synopsis: Court documents have revealed Victorian Building Authority employees were offered bribes to progress building registration applications. Dozens of builders have now been charged.

title.children: Dozens of builders face Melbourne court over alleged bribery scheme
